title: Project Details
description:
Design and implement a multi-source, real-time video analytics and
streaming platform that:
- Aggregates feeds from multiple webcams or IP cameras
- Applies AI-powered analytics (e.g., person detection, motion
heatmaps) on a server
- Streams both raw and annotated video to clients using GStreamer
- Provides a REST API for dynamic control and monitoring
- Includes MQTT as an optional messaging layer for advanced
synchronization
- Offers a simple OpenCV-based client (or web page) to view streams
System Architecture
1. Video Ingestion Layer
- GStreamer pipelines capture N sources (webcam streams) in
parallel.
2. Server-Side Analytics Engine
- In Python (OpenCV + TensorFlow/PyTorch), processes each
frame for:
- Person/object detection (e.g., YOLOv5 Tiny, SSD, ...)
- Motion heatmaps or object tracking stats (optional)
- Outputs annotated frames (bounding boxes/overlays) and
metadata.
3. Streaming Server
- Uses GStreamer to publish:
- Raw video feeds
- Annotated video feeds
4. REST API Server
- Built with Flask or FastAPI
- Endpoints to:
- Start/stop individual streams
- Adjust encoding params (resolution, framerate, bitrate)
- Query system status and analytics metrics
5. Optional: MQTT Integration
- Mosquitto broker + Paho clients
- Topics for control commands and event publishes
6. Client Application
- Simple Python/OpenCV script (or HTML5 video player)
- Connects to endpoints and displays video
- (Bonus) Subscribes to MQTT topics for real-time alerts

title: Project Details
description:
Job Title:
Cryptography Developer (TFHE + Genetic Algorithm Optimization)

Project Title:
“Optimizing Torus Fully Homomorphic Encryption (TFHE) using Genetic Algorithm (TFHE+GA): An Indirect Approach”

Project Overview:
We seeking a skilled and research-oriented developer to assist in the simulation, implementation and optimization of TFHE (Torus Fully Homomorphic Encryption) using Genetic Algorithm (GA) strategies. This role is part of a doctoral research project aimed at significantly improving bootstrapping performance, ciphertext size, and key sizes without compromising cryptographic security.

Key Objectives:
The developer will help achieve the following specific goals:
a. Develop and evaluate GA-based strategies for optimizing the bootstrapping process in TFHE, targeting a 20% reduction in bootstrapping time (from 13 ms to ~10.4 ms).
b. Implement GA-based techniques to minimize the number of bootstrapping operations for evaluating complex Boolean functions in TFHE, with a target reduction of 15%.
c. Optimize the trade-off between cleartext bit-size and the number of homomorphic additions before bootstrapping, aiming for a 10% reduction in ciphertext size while maintaining cryptographic security.
d. Design and evaluate GA-based methods for reducing key and ciphertext sizes in TFHE, targeting a 50% reduction in key size without sacrificing the security of current NTRU-based encryption schemes.

Responsibilities:
Simulate, Implement and modify TFHE libraries in C++ or Python (preferably TFHE, Concrete-ML, or similar)

Design and integrate Genetic Algorithm frameworks using Python (e.g., DEAP, PyGAD, or custom-built solutions)

Benchmark and test cryptographic performance (time, size, and security level)

Document code, experiments, and optimizations for inclusion in research publications and dissertation materials

Work collaboratively with the principal researcher and provide regular progress updates

Required Skills & Qualifications:
Strong experience with cryptographic programming (especially homomorphic encryption, ideally TFHE)

Proficiency in Genetic Algorithms and optimization techniques

Proficient in C++ and Python (especially libraries for crypto and evolutionary computation)

Familiarity with performance profiling, optimization, and benchmarking tools

Background in computer science, mathematics, cryptography, or related field (graduate degree preferred, but not required)

Preferred Qualifications:
Previous experience with FHE libraries (TFHE, Concrete, SEAL, PALISADE, etc.)

Understanding of noise management, bootstrapping, and ciphertext parameter tuning

Familiarity with NTRU and lattice-based cryptographic schemes

Published work or demonstrable portfolio related to crypto/GA/AI optimization

Project Duration: 
3 days for the GA simulation (urgent) and another days for TFHE (with possible extension based on performance and results)

Compensation:
Negotiable, based on experience and contribution level

Work Arrangement:
Remote

title: Project Details
description:
he goal is to build an AI poker bot that can play multi-player, no-limit Texas Hold'em at any table (e.g., 6-max, 9-max). The bot must have a combination of GTO (Game Theory Optimal) play, reinforcement learning to adapt to different opponents, and opponent modeling to exploit weaknesses. It will make real-time decisions within 5 seconds, using OCR to read the game state and make decisions.

1. Development Environment and Tools
Hardware:

GPU: At least NVIDIA RTX 3060 or higher.

CPU: Intel i7 or AMD Ryzen 7.

RAM: 16GB or more.

Storage: 500GB SSD for fast read/write speeds.

Software:

Python: Programming language.

TensorFlow or PyTorch: For building and training the reinforcement learning models.

OpenAI Gym: For creating a simulated poker environment.

PyPokerEngine or OpenHold’em: For poker game simulations.

Tesseract OCR or Google Vision API: For capturing real-time game data from the screen.

2. Create the Poker Game Environment
Multi-Table Play: Set up the environment to support multi-player play (e.g., 6-max and 9-max). The AI should be able to handle different numbers of players at the table.

The bot will adapt to table size and adjust its strategies for multi-player dynamics (e.g., tighter play in a full table and looser play in short-handed games).

Implement configurable tables: Ability to simulate various blinds, stack sizes, and player positions.

Game Logic:

Implement the basic poker game rules: dealing cards, betting rounds, showdown, hand ranking, etc.

Ensure proper handling of game states: pre-flop, post-flop, turn, river, and showdown.

3. GTO-based Strategy Integration
GTO Solver Integration:

Use pre-solved GTO strategies for the AI’s baseline decision-making.

Implement PioSolver or GTO+ (or similar solvers) to get optimal strategies for opening ranges, bet sizing, and post-flop play.

This will serve as the foundation for the AI's play, ensuring it plays solidly in various situations.

Incorporate GTO Data:

Load GTO strategies for each hand and situation. The bot will follow these strategies unless opponent modeling or reinforcement learning suggests a better alternative.

The GTO data should cover a variety of scenarios, including raise sizes, c-betting, check-raising, and bluffing.

4. Build Reinforcement Learning (RL) System
Self-Play Training:

Implement reinforcement learning where the AI learns by playing against itself. The bot will train using Deep Q Networks (DQN) or Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO).

Q-learning will be used to model optimal decisions (e.g., call, fold, raise) based on hand strength and game context.

Reward Function:

Define a reward function to provide feedback for actions:

Positive rewards for winning pots, making correct value bets, folding losing hands.

Negative rewards for losing money (e.g., over-bluffing, poor value betting).

Implement exploration vs. exploitation balance, where the AI explores new strategies but also exploits what works against its opponents.

Opponent Modeling:

Implement a system to track opponent behavior (tight, loose, aggressive, passive) across multiple sessions.

Allow the AI to adjust its strategy based on observed opponent tendencies:

Exploitative play: If the opponent is weak (e.g., calls too much), the AI will adjust by being more aggressive.

Tight players: The AI will adjust by bluffing less and value betting more.

Adaptability:

Allow the bot to switch strategies between GTO and exploitative play based on opponent tendencies.

Track and record opponent behaviors over time to fine-tune the AI’s adaptive strategies.

5. OCR Integration for Real-Time Play
Screen Capture:

Use OCR (Optical Character Recognition) (Tesseract or Google Vision API) to capture game state data:

Player's hand.

Community cards.

Pot size and betting history.

The OCR should extract text and images from the poker client (e.g., PokerStars, 888poker).

Real-Time Data Feeding:

Send this captured data to the AI’s decision-making model for analysis.

Ensure real-time processing to enable the AI to make decisions within 5 seconds of receiving the data.

6. Decision Engine for Real-Time Actions
Decision Making:

Once the game data is captured, the AI will process it and decide whether to fold, call, raise.

The AI’s decision will be based on:

GTO strategies.

Opponent behavior.

Current game state (hand strength, position, stack size).

Outputs should be clear instructions (e.g., “Raise $20”, “Fold”, “Call $15”).

Bet Sizing:

Implement a bet sizing strategy based on the context, position, and opponent. The AI should vary its bet size to maximize EV (Expected Value).

Use range balancing to ensure the AI doesn’t become predictable.

7. Training, Testing, and Evaluation
Training and Self-Play:

Begin training with self-play in a simulated environment. Let the AI play millions of hands to learn optimal strategies.

Evaluate performance after every training cycle by comparing its performance to pre-solved GTO solutions.

Testing Against Real Opponents:

Test the AI against human players or other bots (e.g., low-level bots or GTO-based bots) to evaluate its adaptability and exploitation skills.

Monitor the bot’s win rate, bluffing frequency, and adjustment to opponent behavior.

Tuning Hyperparameters:

Continuously adjust the hyperparameters (learning rate, exploration-exploitation balance, etc.) to fine-tune the model’s performance.

8. Real-Time Deployment and Integration
Integrate with Poker Client:

Ensure seamless integration of the AI with poker platforms (e.g., PokerStars, 888poker).

The AI should be able to read the screen, process data, and output decisions in real-time.

User Interface:

Develop a simple interface that shows the AI’s decision-making process (e.g., Raise $20, Call $10).

Allow users to track the AI’s performance and settings (e.g., select table size, change bet sizes, etc.).

9. Monetization and Business Model
Subscription Model:

Charge users a monthly subscription fee for access to the AI. Provide basic functionality with premium upgrades for more advanced features (e.g., custom strategies, real-time advice).

Freemium Model:

Offer a free trial or a limited version of the AI (e.g., no multi-table support, limited strategies), and offer a premium version with full functionality for a subscription fee.

Marketing:

Market to online poker players via social media, Twitch, and poker forums. Leverage affiliate marketing with poker platforms.

10. Ongoing Maintenance and Updates
Regular Updates:

Continuously improve the AI’s performance by adding new features, updating strategies, and adapting to changes in the poker meta.

Regularly test the bot against real players to ensure its effectiveness.

Bug Fixes and Optimization:

Address any bugs or inefficiencies in the system. Continuously optimize performance to reduce latency and improve decision-making speed.

title: Project Details
description:
Tradimg bot wit causor ai 
Trading

이미지 screenshot.png에는 특정 주식의 차트가 포함되어 있습니다.

1. pytesseract를 사용해서 이미지 안에서 다음 정보를 추출해줘:
   - 분석 구간 날짜 (예: 2011-02-01 ~ 2011-02-03)
   - 지표 설정 (예: 볼린저밴드 20, 2 / RSI 14 등)
   - 차트 주기 (예: 1분봉, 15분봉)

2. 추출된 내용을 기반으로 yfinance에서 데이터를 불러와서:
   - 지정된 구간
   - 지정된 주기별 (1분, 15분 등)
   - 지정된 지표 포함

3. 이 전략으로 매수/매도 시점을 잡아 백테스트를 해줘.

4. 각 지표의 설정값을 최적화해서, 승률/수익률/손익비가 최대가 되는 조합도 찾아줘.

5. 시각화 차트를 log scale과 일반 차트로 각각 보여줘.

6. 마지막 결과는 HTML 형식 보고서로 저장해줘.

title: Project Details
description:
I'm looking to build an advanced AI voice chatbot. The project includes several key components:

1. Voice Interface:
   - Google Speech-to-Text & Amazon Polly
   - Support for Hindi and various regional accents
   - User interactions via voice commands, conversational dialogue, and query-based responses

2. NLP Model:
   - Rasa or Sarvam AI for Indian languages
   - Custom corpus for household vocabulary

3. Backend:
   - Node.js and Firebase
   - User data storage and real-time updates

4. Mobile App:
   - Developed in Flutter for both Android and iOS
   - Integration with WhatsApp and YouTube APIs

5. AI Avatar:
   - Built with Python and Blender
   - 3D animation with intermediate detail
   - Lip-sync capabilities with regional accents

6. Hosting:
   - AWS Mumbai (GDPR-Compliant)
   - Utilizing EC2, S3, and CloudFront

Ideal Skills and Experience:
- Expertise in voice recognition and synthesis
- Strong NLP background, especially with Indian languages
- Proficient in Node.js, Firebase, and Flutter
- Experience in 3D animation and Python
- Familiarity with AWS services and GDPR compliance

Please provide a portfolio showcasing relevant work.

title: Project Details
description:
Project Details 
$99.00 – 100.00 USD
 
n8n Automation Challenge for CRE — Build 4 Workflows & Win Long-Term Role + Equity
Opportunity: Competitive audition to become the lead automation developer for a growing AI infrastructure agency targeting US Commercial Real Estate (CRE) brokerages.

Prize for the Best Submission:
Ongoing paid work $2000 per build (customizing workflows for real clients)
Equity stake (milestone-based starting from 6 months) in the business
Founding technical builder title in a high-potential niche with solutions that are not being done in this market, lets become an apex ai solution and run an entire sector and geographic location.

The Challenge
Develop 6 n8n workflows (dummy-data versions) that revolutionize CRE operations:
Lead Generation Engine – Scrape/parse CRE leads from target sources.
Instant Deal Analyzer – Auto-calculate ROI, CAP rates, etc..
Tour Scheduler Pro – Sync tours across broker/owner calendars.
Client Nurture Bot – Automated check-ins + updates via email/SMS.

What We Provide
Detailed workflow specs & dummy datasets
Example SOPs, forms, and expected outputs
Feedback/support during the challenge

What We Offer
Contract to work for startup business exclusively getting paid $2000 per job for 14 days work maximum then every build will probably max be 5-7 days but the money is the same. Equity share in potential 6-7 figure business. 7-14 days work could secure you financial freedom by dominating a market with the only solution of its kind for a market that needs this solution, Your move.

Tech Stack
n8n (core)

Google Workspace (Sheets, Calendar, Gmail)

Telegram Bot API (for notifications)

SMTP/Email APIs (SendGrid, Mailchimp, etc.)

Optional: Light web scraping (ethical, rate-limited)

9 API connections 3 to LLM's, 6 to various AI solutions to create an infrastructure that will dominate this market

Submission Requirements
Exported n8n JSON files (all 4 workflows)

5-min Loom video explaining your architecture

Error-handling approach (how you’d debug real-world use)

Timeline & proposed improvements

18 days from acceptance

Ideal Candidate
Proven n8n experience (portfolio/GitHub links required)

Strong with API integrations, data pipelines, and modular workflows

Familiar with CRE tools (e.g., Costar, REIS) is a plus

Interested in long-term collaboration (not just one-off gigs)

Timeline
18 days

Winner announced: 18 days from start date

How to Apply
Reply with:

Brief intro + n8n project examples

Why you’re a fit for CRE automation

Estimated time to complete the challenge

Only one winner selected. Ready to build the future of CRE tech?

title: Project Details
description:
I choose the first that say Yes I do it for 500usd

500usd I pay

Send pm 


Project Brief – “BÄSTIS” App

App type: Mobile (iOS and Android)
Goal: To build a personal AI assistant app that helps everyday users understand official documents, confusing letters, or difficult situations. The app should be ultra-simple, safe, and trustworthy.

⸻

1. Core Concept

Users can:
	•	Scan a document (e.g. a letter or decision) → the app explains what it means
	•	Ask a question by voice → the app answers clearly
	•	Ask a question by typing → the app answers immediately

The app gives personalized, AI-generated answers. It does not store images or audio, but it should remember basic user preferences over time to provide better answers.

⸻

2. Interface (very simple)

Main screen has just three buttons/icons:
	•	Camera icon (scan a document)
	•	Microphone icon (ask by voice)
	•	Pen icon (ask by typing)

Additional screens:
	•	Input screen (camera/mic/text)
	•	Response screen (shows AI-generated answer)
	•	Login screen (mobile number + SMS code)
	•	Settings screen: view/edit profile, delete all data

Max total: 5 screens

⸻

3. User Memory / Profile (cloud-based)

To personalize answers, the app stores a minimal, secure profile for each user:

{
  "nickname": "Johan",
  "tone": "direct and calm",
  "language": "sv",
  "topics": ["child law", "insurance", "school"],
  "sensitive_topics": ["divorce"],
  "last_questions": [
    "What does this letter mean?",
    "Can I refuse this meeting?"
  ]
}

Stored securely in Firebase or Supabase.
No documents, images, or audio are saved.
This is only used to improve AI response quality and tone.

⸻

4. Privacy & Security
	•	No passwords or accounts – only mobile number + SMS verification
	•	No behavioral tracking
	•	All profile data is encrypted in the cloud
	•	App must be fully GDPR-compliant
	•	User can always delete their profile completely

⸻

5. Tech Stack Suggestions

You may choose the stack, but here’s a suggested stack:
	•	Frontend: Flutter (or React Native)
	•	OCR: Google ML Kit (on-device text recognition)
	•	AI: OpenAI GPT-4o (for text understanding & generation)
	•	Backend/DB: Firebase Firestore or Supabase
	•	Authentication: SMS login (Firebase Auth or similar)

⸻

6. Design & Tone
	•	The app should feel: friendly, smart, clear, and non-corporate
	•	No ads
	•	No dashboards
	•	Just fast, human-style answers to real-life problems
	•	The assistant should “speak like the user” – calm, kind, or direct depending on preferences

⸻

7. Deliverables
	•	Fully working app (iOS + Android)
	•	Codebase and deployment support
	•	All source files (code, design, AI logic)
	•	Admin access or instructions for future updates
	•	Help publishing to App Store & Google Play (if needed)

title: Project Details
description:
I want to build a Jarvis-like prototype that can assist me with real-world tasks, similar to Alexa but personalized. This setup should allow me to add my own features as I see fit.

Requirements:
- Voice commands for interaction
- Notifications and alerts
- Reminders
- Real-time information retrieval, like:
  - Stock values (e.g., "What is the stock value of Tata now?")
  - Weather updates (e.g., "What is the temperature now?")
  - Sports scores (e.g., "What is the cricket score now?" or "Send notifications for any wickets or milestones in LPL")

Ideal skills and experience:
- Experience in developing AI personal assistants
- Proficiency in voice recognition and command processing
- Knowledge in real-time data integration (stocks, weather, sports)
- Familiarity with customizable, user-driven setups
